title: Facebook reaches commercial agreement with AR display maker Plessey
text: Facebook Inc. on Monday announced it has reached a commercial agreement with Plessey to "support the development, design, and manufacturing of new display technologies for potential use in future AR/VR products," a Facebook spokesperson told MarketWatch.

title: Facebook Throws Local News $100 Million Lifeline Amid COVID-19 Pandemic
text: Facebook wants to help local news outlets continue to report on the coronavirus and is throwing $100 million toward the effort.

title: Bet on these tech stocks to bounce back after coronavirus pandemic, says Morgan Stanley
text: A handful of tech companies will emerge from the COVID-19 pandemic stronger, while investors should expect other businesses to weaken, according to a research note from Morgan Stanley.

title: Facebook is giving $25 million to news organizations
text: Facebook will give $25 million in emergency grants for local news to support journalism during the coronavirus pandemic, and will spend $75 million more on ads with news outlets that have seen a significant decline in their revenue, it announced Monday.

title: Facebook commits $100 million to support news media hurt by the virus crisis
text: Facebook pledged $100 million in financing and ad spending to support news organizations, including local publishers in the U.S., reeling from pressure due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Facebook pledges $100 million to support news industry during COVID-19 pandemic
text:
“If people needed more proof that local journalism is a vital public service, they’re getting it now,” Facebook said in a blog post announcing the initiative. 
As lockdowns and stay-in-place orders continue to be extended in countries around the world, millions of people are spending their days frequenting online publications to find out the latest about the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Facebook To Invest $100M In News Outlets During Coronavirus Crisis
text: Facebook says it is investing $100M to support news reporting during the coronavirus pandemic. The social media giant is putting up a $25M emergency relief fund for local news through its Facebook Journalism Project, and is placing a further $75M in additional marketing spend with news organizations around the world.
